greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A324121(A122111(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..12000
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
program: A122111(n) = if(1==n,n,my(f=factor(n), es=Vecrev(f[,2]),is=concat(apply(primepi,Vecrev(f[,1])),[0]),pri=0,m=1); for(i=1, #es, pri += es[i]; m *= prime(pri)^(is[i]-is[1+i])); (m));

A336314(n) = if(1==n,1,my(f=factor(n),es=Vecrev(f[,2]),is=concat(apply(primepi,Vecrev(f[,1])),[0]),pri=0,d=1,s=1,x=1,p,e); for(i=1, #es, pri += es[i]; p = prime(pri); e = 1+is[i]-is[1+i]; d *= e; s *= ((p^e)-1)/(p-1); x *= (p^(e-1))); gcd(s,x*d));
xref: Cf. A336317 (gives the positions where this coincides with A323173).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 19 2020
